quest.name: Tip-top Gear
journal:
Regitt has a message for you.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the dwarven designer at Radisca's Round.
The dwarven designer has tasked you with crafting low-profile custom options, then delivering the completed items to Regitt.
objectives: Speak with the dwarven designer at Radisca's Round.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: You're a wanted womanman, Forename. In a good way, I mean! One of the two brothers in charge of our tanks' exterior design has asked me to ask you if he can borrow your artisanal expertise. I always forget which one is which...

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Anyway, if you're free to lend a hand, you'll find him collecting parts and materials over at Radisca's Round.

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Lali-ho, Forename! Regitt passed on my message, then? Good! Now we can get down to making some stealth-enhancing accessories.

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: See, if I were a merchant in the market for a tank, I'd want a catalog of custom options designed to lower my profile and reduce the risk of alerting eaters and other wild beasts!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: My little brother, on the other hand, seems fixed on the idea of announcing one's presence to the whole damn world. Who would want such a thing!?

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: I need you to help me change his mind...by forging a practical range of camouflage-patterned attachments!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: I need you to help me change his mind...by creating a crafty assortment of camouflage netting!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: I need you to help me change his mind...by mixing a sneaky selection of camouflage-coating paint!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Here, take these materials from the stock I've collected...and feel free to ask if you need more. Once you're done, deliver the goods to Regitt─that'll show my brother the benefits of blending into the background!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Take the finished product back to the Anvil. Regitt will know what to do!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Take the finished product back to the Anvil. Regitt will know what to do!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Take the finished product back to the Anvil. Regitt will know what to do!

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Looking for some spare materials? Help yourself.

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Looking for some spare materials? Help yourself.

dialogue.name: DWARF03928
dialogue.text: Looking for some spare materials? Help yourself.

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Got something for me?

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: So this is the kind of thing he was talking about...

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Assuming our tanks become commonplace, the merchant caravans'll be wanting an edge over their competitors in the survival stakes. And these custom options are just the answer we need! Fine work, Forename!

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: This...all feels so familiar. You're saying it was the older brother this time? But...the concept is the complete bloody opposite! Ugh, I'm sorry these dolts have dragged you into their little design dispute...

dialogue.name: REGITT
dialogue.text: Still, I suppose if this rivalry results in more custom options for our buyers, then it's a victory for us either way. Thanks again for your fine work, Forename!
